meta_description: See glass in a new light through the art, history, and science of glass. Explore the world's largest glass museum, watch live glassmaking demos, and make your own glass.
hours_text:
# Plan Your Visit

Kids 17 under free

Corning Museum of Glass offers something for all ages and interests.

**Museum admission tickets are valid for two consecutive days.**

[ Buy museum tickets ](http://web.archive.org/web/20251001022504/https://reservations.cmog.org/)

[ Reserve Member Tickets ](http://web.archive.org/web/20251001022504/https://reservations.cmog.org/Info.aspx?EventID=11)

Bring your smartphone or tablet and headphones to the Museum, connect to our free WiFi, and recharge your mobile device at one of the 40+ free charging stations located throughout the Museum campus.

_**Questions?**_**** Check out our [Visitor Guidelines](/web/20251001022504/https://visit.cmog.org/plan-your-visit/visitor-guidelines), [Accessibility](/web/20251001022504/https://visit.cmog.org/plan-your-visit/accessibility), and [Visiting with Kids & Teens](http://web.archive.org/web/20251001022504/https://visit.cmog.org/visiting-with-kids) pages to help you plan ahead for your visit. 

##  Admission Prices

###  Corning Museum of Glass 

Adults

**$25**

Discounted Admission  
college students, age 62+, and military

**$22**

Local Residents

**$12.50**

Members

**FREE**

Age 17 & Under

**FREE**

###  Visit Two Museums and Save!  
Corning Museum of Glass + [Rockwell Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20251001022504/https://www.rockwellmuseum.org/)

Adults 

**$35**

Discounted Admission  
age 62+ and military

**$31.50**

College Students

**$27**

Local Residents

**$18.50**

Members

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

The Corning Museum of Glass is committed to making its collections, buildings, programs, and services accessible to all audiences.

##  Assistive Listening Devices 

We offer assistive listening devices in the Amphitheater Hot Shop for guests watching our Hot Glass Demonstrations. There are several options available to guests: a headset receiver with headphones attached, or a lanyard receiver that utilizes a guest’s own headphones/buds or hearing aids. If using an induction loop, you'll need to adjust your personal hearing device to tune in to the broadcast.

##  Color Blind Glasses 

If you’re red-green color blind, come try [EnChroma](http://web.archive.org/web/20251001022504/https://enchroma.com/) glasses for color blindness and experience the vibrant colors at the Corning Museum of Glass. You can borrow and enjoy EnChroma glasses during your visit as part of our mission of accessibility and inclusivity for all of our members and patrons. EnChroma glasses enable people with red-green color blindness to see an expanded range of clear, vibrant, distinct colors and enjoy enhanced detail and depth perception. Glasses are available at our Admissions Desk on a first-come, first-served basis. If you'd like to reserve the glasses in advance of your visit or have any questions please email [[email protected]](/web/20251001022504/https://visit.cmog.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#e7828392a7848a8880c9889580) or call +1 (607) 438-5401 to make arrangements (2 weeks noti...

#  Art & Design 

The world's largest space dedicated to the display of contemporary art and design in glass.

[ Exhibitions and Galleries ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260113125250/https://whatson.cmog.org/node/1741)

#  History & Culture 

Explore 3500 years of glass and glassmaking from antiquity through present day.

[ 35 Centuries of Glass Galleries ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260113125250/https://whatson.cmog.org/exhibitions-galleries/35-centuries-glass)
